runs.comm: what a delivery to start. Full, swinging, tailing towards off, beats the bat, misses the off stick by a whisket
short of a length, wide outside off, 138ks, beats his attempt at the punch, called a wide. That's a bit harsh
the faster they come, the fatser they go. Half-volley at 142ks, outside off, and he drives it on the tun, between mid-off and extra cover, all along the ground
length ball, widish, the bat handle turns as he looks to drive at it without any feet. Back she goes to the bowler
short of a length, punched away square, the ball flies across the fast outfield, Ravi Rampaul is slow on his feet from third man, but puts in a swinging-pool dive to keep in
full, driven back into the pitch, and it threatens to bounce over Castro's head, who parries it to mid-off
short of a length, wide, doesn't come on at all, Warner is early into the punch and limply hits it to mid-off for one
Rampaul starts with a bouncer, Warner upper-cuts it, more like a boxer than other upper-cuts, in the sense that he really threw his hands at it. The third man came around, but was lobbed
length ball, on off, pushed to cover
Warner goes boom again. Length ball, on off, drives inside-out, over mid-off. This chase is on at, at least at the moment
this is a crazy game. Short, into the ribs, and he has short-arm pulled it over deep square leg. Top timing
Beaten. Short of a length, outside off, angling away, beats him. I think it seamed a bit too. But he has overstepped too
Warner clears the front leg, gets a length ball, goes at it with all his might, gets a thick inside edge between the keeper and short fine leg
nicely bowled. On a length, middle and leg, gets a thick edge from him, but Warner takes a single to keep the strike again. Watson has been a spectator so far

Warner is not going anywhere, but the finger has gone up. Stands, smiles wryly, and walks off. He is not happy, is Warner. This is a length ball outside off, Warner plays for the swing and tries the big booming drive. The ball doesn't quite come in, and Edwards and Ramdin are fairly certain he has nicked it. So is Asad Rauf. But Warner is raging. There was a noise but no deviation. We don't have a hotspot or snicko
and just like that, without fuss, he runs a length ball to third man for one
length ball, into the pads, worked away for one
short, wide, Hussey cuts it over point. No fuss again. Edwards kicks at the ground in disgust
short of a length, slight shape away, runs off the thick edge for a single to third man
short of a length, just outside off, steered away to third man
straight delivery first up, glanced to short fine for one
short of a length, on the pads, turning towards off, pushed wide of cover
big offbreak, short of a length, outside off, turns down leg, cramps him up
short of a length, turning in from outside off, worked away for a single
short of a length, outside leg, turns towards the stumps, Hussey pushes to midwicket and wants one, but Watson doesn't. They are all safe, though, with Samuels's misfield
full, on off, driven to long-off
short ball, on the stumps, pulled in the air as it hurries onto him, but it doesn't carry to mid-on
short, 122ks, Watson doesn't bother going back, and pulls away off the front foot. Gets a single to deep midwicket
short of a length, hits him on the pads, and then bounces into his face. Good job he is wearing a helmet
short-arm pull-drive. Length ball, pitched leg, angling towards off, Hussey stays low, clears the front leg, and lofts it wide long-on
slower ball, looks to late-cut it, but can't beat backward point
short of a length, angling in, Hussey backs away, gets a bottom edge for one
short offbreak, pulled flat towards deep midwicket, Smith charges in even though he knows he is not going to make it, and does well to get his body behind this half-volley
the carrom ball, Watson doesn't read it, and it squeezes under his pulling bat
another carrom ball, but this time he has overstepped
offbreak, on off, on a length, and a free hit. That's recipe for a slog-swept six from Watson
carrom ball, backs away to cut it wide of cover for one
big offbreak, on off, turning away sharply, Hussey gets a bottom edge towards short third man
straight delivery, on a length, middle and leg, Watson backs away to muscle it to long-on for one
short of a length, just outside off, late-cut away to third man
slower ball, short of a length, punched to long-off for one
that kicked at him. Short of a length, and bounces towards his chest. Watsin's head falls back as he fends with soft hands. It doesn't carry to point
short of a length, on off, defended back to him
short of a length, into the pads, worked away for a single
innovation. Hussey walks across the stumps, takes a perfectly acceptable length ball on off, and drags it to the right of short fine leg
length ball, quick, on middle and leg, pushed to long-on
he has made up his mind to sweep long before he leaves the ball. Samuels is short and quick, but he still it drags it from wide outside off for a single to short fine
short, flat, outside off, and he has got the room to swing at it and drag it over midwicket. That went flat and fast for four

oh that seemed like he had mis-hit. The bat face turned open as he tried to loft over long-off, but it kept flying over the man. what bats are they using? Or are they playing in the rarefied atmosphere of Johannesburg?
short, flat, Watson pulls straight to deep midwicket, but this has burst through the hands of DR Smith. What a drop. That was simple by Smith's standards. That could have the final say in the match
short of a length, angling in, rocks back, and whacks it away past square leg
slower ball, full on off, pushed to long-off for one
another slow ball, 110ks, full, on the pads, and flicked away for one
slow again, and short, and he has pulled it into the vacant deep square leg region. This is weird field placement. No square leg inside the circle, and none at the boundary either
gives him the charge, Bravo bowls slow again, and this time Hussey hits straight to straight extra cover
low full toss, first time he has bowled at regular pace, and it's driven to long-off for one
slower ball, almost like a flighted delivery from a spinner. The half-volley is driven back at Bravo, and he misfields to allow a single
length ball, on off, stops at him, it is bowled at 123ks, and it is chipped short of long-on
